meanings.definition: Seeking to impose a doctrine in all circumstances without regard to practical considerations.
meanings.sent1: The doctrinaire approach to problem-solving often overlooks real-world challenges.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her doctrinaire beliefs that rarely adapted to changing situations.
meanings.sent3: The doctrinaire professor insisted on following the textbook word for word, even when it didn't make sense.
meanings.sent4: His doctrinaire attitude towards innovation stifled creativity in the team.
meanings.sent5: The company's failure was a result of their doctrinaire policies that refused to evolve.

meanings.definition: A person who seeks to impose a doctrine in all circumstances without regard to practical considerations.
meanings.sent1: The new manager was a strict doctrinaire who enforced rules without flexibility.
meanings.sent2: As a doctrinaire, he often clashed with colleagues who valued adaptability.
meanings.sent3: The doctrinaire's insistence on following rules to the letter led to some comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: She saw him as a doctrinaire dictator, ruling the office with an iron fist.
meanings.sent5: The image of the doctrinaire leader haunted the employees, stifling their creativity.
